id.desc: Component ID, not specified by default. If specified, it can be used to refer the component in option or API.

orient.desc:
The layout orientation of toolbox's icon.

Options:
+ 'horizontal'
+ 'vertical'

itemGap.desc: The gap between each icon of toolbox. It is horizontal gap in horizontal layout, while vertical gap in vertical layout.

showTitle.desc: Whether to show the title of each tool icon when mouse hovers.

feature.saveAsImage.type.desc:
File suffix of the image saved.

+ If the `renderer` is set to be `'canvas'` when chart [initialized](api.html#echarts.init) (default), then `'png'` (default) and `'jpg'` are supported.
+ If the `renderer` is set to be `'svg'` when when chart [initialized](api.html#echarts.init), then only `'svg'` is supported for `type` (`'svg'` type is supported since `v4.8.0`).

feature.saveAsImage.name.desc: Name to save the image, whose default value is [title.text](~title.text).

feature.saveAsImage.backgroundColor.desc: Background color to save the image, whose default value is [backgroundColor](~backgroundColor). If `backgroundColor` is not set, white color is used.

feature.saveAsImage.connectedBackgroundC.desc: When [echarts.connect](api.html#echarts.connect) is used to connect the interaction of multiple chart series, they will all be included in the exported image. This option sets the background color between these charts.

feature.saveAsImage.excludeComponents.desc: Components to be excluded when export. By default, toolbox is excluded.

feature.saveAsImage.icon.desc:
It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```



Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.desc: The style setting of save as image icon. Since icon label is displayed only when hovering on the icon, the label configuration options are available under `emphasis`.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.color.desc:
color.



> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](~color) for details

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderColo.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderWidt.desc:
border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

(${name} ? ${name} : "") + " border width. No border when it is set to be 0."

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderType.desc:
border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderDash.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderCap.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderJoin.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`borderMiterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.borderMite.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`borderJoin`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.shadowBlur.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.shadowColo.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.shadowOffs.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.
Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

feature.saveAsImage.iconStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`borderMiterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

feature.dataZoom.xAxisIndex.desc: Defines which [xAxis](~xAxis) should be controlled. By default, it controls all x axes. If it is set to be `false`, then no x axis is controlled. If it is set to be then it controls axis with axisIndex of `3`. If it is set to be `[0, 3]`, it controls the x-axes with axisIndex of `0` and `3`.

feature.dataZoom.yAxisIndex.desc: Defines which [yAxis](~yAxis) should be controlled. By default, it controls all y axes. If it is set to be `false`, then no y axis is controlled. If it is set to be then it controls axis with axisIndex of `3`. If it is set to be `[0, 3]`, it controls the x-axes with axisIndex of `0` and `3`.

feature.dataZoom.icon.zoom.desc:
It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```



Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```

```

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

feature.magicType.iconStyle.shadowBlur.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

feature.magicType.iconStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

feature.magicType.iconStyle.shadowOffset.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.
Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

feature.magicType.iconStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

feature.magicType.emphasis.iconStyle.col.desc:
color.



> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](~color) for details

feature.magicType.emphasis.iconStyle.bor.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

(${name} ? ${name} : "") + " border width. No border when it is set to be 0."

border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`borderMiterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`borderJoin`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

feature.magicType.option.desc: Configuration item for each type, which will be used when switching to certain type.

feature.brush.desc:
Brush-selecting icon.

It can also be configured at [brush.toolbox](~brush.toolbox).

feature.brush.type.desc:
Icons used, whose values are:

+ `'rect'`: Enabling selecting with rectangle area.
+ `'polygon'`: Enabling selecting with any shape.
+ `'lineX'`: Enabling horizontal selecting.
+ `'lineY'`: Enabling vertical selecting.
+ `'keep'`: Switching between *single selecting* and *multiple selecting*. The latter one can select multiple areas, while the former one cancels previous selection.
+ `'clear'`: Clearing all selection.

Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

iconStyle.desc: The style setting of Shared icon. Since icon label is displayed only when hovering on the icon, the label configuration options are available under `emphasis`.

iconStyle.color.desc:
color.



> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](~color) for details

iconStyle.borderColor.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

iconStyle.borderWidth.desc:
border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

(${name} ? ${name} : "") + " border width. No border when it is set to be 0."

iconStyle.borderType.desc:
border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

iconStyle.borderDashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

iconStyle.borderCap.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

iconStyle.borderJoin.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`borderMiterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

iconStyle.borderMiterLimit.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`borderJoin`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

iconStyle.shadowBlur.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

iconStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

iconStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

iconStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

iconStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

emphasis.iconStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

emphasis.iconStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

emphasis.iconStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

emphasis.iconStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

emphasis.iconStyle.textFill.desc: Fill color of text. If it's not set, it will use in the order of icon's fill color, stroke color, and `'#000'`.

zlevel.desc:
`zlevel` value of all graphical elements in .

`zlevel` is used to make layers with Canvas. Graphical elements with different `zlevel` values will be placed in different Canvases, which is a common optimization technique. We can put those frequently changed elements (like those with animations) to a separate `zlevel`. Notice that too many Canvases will increase memory cost, and should be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid crash.

Canvases with bigger `zlevel` will be placed on Canvases with smaller `zlevel`.

z.desc:
`z` value of all graphical elements in , which controls order of drawing graphical components. Components with smaller `z` values may be overwritten by those with larger `z` values.

`z` has a lower priority to `zlevel`, and will not create new Canvas.

left.desc:
Distance between toolbox component and the left side of the container.

`left` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

top.desc:
Distance between toolbox component and the top side of the container.

`top` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

right.desc:
Distance between toolbox component and the right side of the container.

`right` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

Adaptive by default.

bottom.desc:
Distance between toolbox component and the bottom side of the container.

`bottom` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

Adaptive by default.

width.desc: Width of toolbox component. Adaptive by default.

height.desc: Height of toolbox component. Adaptive by default.
